title: Windows Powertoys - Did you know it was a thing?
html:
Recently I discovered PowerToys. If you don't know about this, then congratulations because you should totally install this right now. It surely has something you can make use of!

PowerToys is basically a set of tools that are nice-to-haves for most people. It's things like a Color Picker, Window Zones, Spotlight (from MacOS), Bulk Rename, etc. As of this date, there are 9 tools in total.

Click to see the list of all the tools
Color PickerLiterally a system-wide color picker that supports Hex, RGB, and HSL! [images, view page to see]
Fancy ZonesWindows already had some seriously solid window tiling, but fancy zones takes it to the next level! [images, view page to see]
File Explorer add-ons (Preview Pane)Now you can preview SVGs and Markdown files in the preview pane! [images, view page to see]
Image ResizerBulk Image resizing. It's not something I would use often, but there have been times when I had to use [IrfanView](https://www.irfanview.com/) to achieve this functionality. [images, view page to see]
Keyboard ManagerI'll probably not use this much either, but again, it's a great feature by itself! [images, view page to see]
Power RenameThere were a few times when I had to use third-party tools to do this. [images, view page to see]
PowerToys Run (Spotlight)SO MUCH YES! This is basically MacOS's Spotlight, though slightly limited in functionality. But this is so good nonetheless! [images, view page to see]
Shortcut GuideIt's useful sometimes... sometimes. [images, view page to see]
Video Conference MuteI guess it's handy if you can't disable mic/cam by other means. [images, view page to see]

My favorites are Fancy Zones, and PowerToys Run.

Fancy Zones allows me to create custom layout grids that I can snap windows to using hotkeys (Win + Left/Right). It's exceptionally useful when I want a dashboard like setup going on with multiple windows. For example: I'm writing some code, but I don't need the whole screen for that. So the top half of the remaining half of the screen is taken up by Slack, and the bottom half by Discord or something!

[images, view page to see]

PowerToys Run is just so good for when I want to launch an app, or do quick math. I don't need to pin a dozen things to my taskbar anymore, or find an icon on the desktop, or start menu. You know, basically do Spotlight things!

I can't however, do currency conversions in it yet.

[images, view page to see]
